tweet: We are grateful every day for the sacrifice our veterans have made. Today I'm proud to introduce the Protecting Affordable Mortgages for Veterans Act of 2019, a bipartisan bill to show that Congress is keeping faith with our commitment to veterans.  https://bit.ly/2V3DKH1  #HR1988
Enjoyed meeting with the dynamic @stockbridgecity Youth Ambassadors and hearing about their bright, ambitious plans for the future. #GA13 pic.twitter.com/osUKJipbOD

Thank you @IJM advocates Karolina Morsillo and Amy Fields for an informative discussion of how Congress can lead the fight to end human trafficking. Proud to support their work and the @statedept Office to Monitor and Combat Trafficking in Persons. pic.twitter.com/JgEfPlb6jA

I’m a proud cosponsor of the #EqualityAct introduced today to extend the full protections of the landmark Civil Rights Act of 1964 to LGBTQ Americans. This bipartisan bill will bring our nation closer to its founding promise of equality and justice for all. pic.twitter.com/Gwwszdhixl
Thanks @Creekside_High and @creeksideffa15 students for providing my staff a tour of your outstanding agriculture careers pathway program. pic.twitter.com/7g93XM2Ubu

Honored to visit and keynote the Men’s Day Worship Celebration at Travelers Rest Church today in Clayton County. Thank you Rev. Arthur Powell for the invitation. pic.twitter.com/Cu2gzlIhx7

FinTech companies have been the driving force for progress over the past decade and Georgia has become the epicenter. I'm excited to continue work as co-chair of the bipartisan Congressional FinTech and Payments Caucus for the third consecutive term. https://bit.ly/2Usv10z

This past election, Georgians faced blatant assaults on our most fundamental right, the right to vote. Today I’m voting for #HR1 to protect every citizen’s right to vote, ensure the integrity of our elections, end voter roll purging, and modernize the U.S. voting system. pic.twitter.com/9XQ2qKOjrV
